remarks: Define the diagonal functor, which is the functor ` C --> ( D Func C ) ` whose object part is ` x e. C |-> ( y e. D |-> x ) ` .  The value of the functor at an object ` x ` is the constant functor which maps all objects in ` D ` to ` x ` and all morphisms to ` 1 ( x ) ` .  The morphism part is a natural transformation between these functors, which takes ` f : x --> y ` to the natural transformation with every component equal to ` f ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2017.)
statement:
df-diag $p |- DiagFunc = ( c e. Cat , d e. Cat |-> ( <. c , d >. curryF ( c 1stF d ) ) ) $.
$d c d $.
